location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Charles Edwards, Bushire to Lewis Pelly

mods.abstract: Letter regarding arrangements that have been made for Pelly to visit the Governor [of Bushire]; a complaint made against the Nakhoda of a Koweit [Kuwait] Bugla which is now in Bombay; and requesting Pelly's signature for some passes.A postscript to the letter informs Pelly of Agha Jan who had undertaken the maintenance and care of the Carriage and Horses for the previous Resident, Felix Jones and the arrangements for paying him for his services; monies received from Captain Ledley which were payment of a fine by the Bahrein [Bahrain] Chief and regarding reports that Telegraph vessels had arrived at Chobar [Chahbar].
